reasons_to_visit.details: May often brings delightful, mild spring weather (avg highs ~20°C/68°F) with significantly longer daylight hours, perfect for exploring Basel's Altstadt, strolling the Rhine promenade, and enjoying parks.
Experience Basel's green spaces like the University Botanical Garden, Merian Gärten, and Kannenfeldpark coming alive with spring colours and vibrant blooms.
Terraces ('Terrassen') at cafes and restaurants flourish, especially in Marktplatz, Barfüsserplatz, and along the Rhine. Riverside 'Buvetten' (seasonal bars) start opening.
Enjoy Basel's world-class museums (Kunstmuseum, Fondation Beyeler, Tinguely), the Minster, and Altstadt charm with fewer tourists than in July/August.
Comfortable temperatures for cycling along the Rhine, walking through the Old Town, or taking day trips to nearby Alsace (France) or the Black Forest (Germany).
The four 'Fähri' Rhine ferries operate frequently, offering charming cross-river trips. The Rhine promenade becomes a popular spot for walking, relaxing, and socializing.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: May can still be unpredictable, with potential for rainy days, cooler spells, or afternoon thunderstorms interrupting outdoor plans.
May sees a noticeable increase in tourism. Expect more people at key sites (especially museums) and rising prices for flights/accommodation as summer approaches.
May 1st (Labour Day) and Ascension Day (Jeudi de l'Ascension - variable date) are public holidays with widespread shop closures affecting shopping and some services.
Grass pollen levels are often high in May, potentially causing discomfort for allergy sufferers spending time outdoors in parks or along the Rhine.
Despite warmer air temperatures, the Rhine's water is generally far too cold for comfortable swimming for most people in May (swimming season usually starts June/July).

weather.precipitation: Mix of sunny, pleasant spring days and periods of rain or showers. Still potential for cooler days, especially early May.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters, a light to medium-weight jacket (waterproof useful), comfortable walking shoes. Sunscreen, sunglasses needed for sunny days. Allergy medication if needed.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate and increasing. Busy around May 1st holiday and potentially Ascension Day if early. More relaxed than summer.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder/High season prices begin. Book ahead, especially around public holidays or if large conferences are scheduled.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: City bursts into spring colours. Parks are beautiful. Outdoor cafe culture thrives. May 1st brings closures/demonstrations.

events_holidays.name: Labour Day (Tag der Arbeit)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Expect potential demonstrations. Widespread closures of shops, banks, offices.
events_holidays.notes: Check opening hours for museums/attractions (many open). Public transport usually runs normally.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Auffahrt / Jeudi de l'Ascension)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday creating a long weekend for many. Shops closed.
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Attractions usually open. Can be a busy travel weekend.

events_holidays.name: Potential Basel Museum Night (Museumsnacht)
events_holidays.date: Sometimes a Friday in May (Check exact dates!)
events_holidays.description: Many Basel museums open late with special programs, workshops, music, and food, usually for a single entry fee ('Kulturpass').
events_holidays.notes: Date varies yearly! Often January, but sometimes May. Check official program ('Museumsnacht Basel'). Very popular.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic streets, admire the architecture, visit the Basel Minster (climb towers for views), see the Rathaus (Town Hall), and browse unique shops.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for cobblestones. Kleinbasel offers trendy shops/cafes; Grossbasel has more historical sites.

unique_experiences.activity: Stroll Through the University Botanical Garden
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the diverse plant collections in Basel's historic botanical garden, showcasing spring blooms outdoors and varied climates in the greenhouses.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. A peaceful escape. Greenhouses offer shelter if it rains.

unique_experiences.description: Explore Switzerland's largest public art collection, spanning Old Masters to modern art, in its impressive main building and Neubau extension.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours. Check opening times (closed Mondays). Book tickets online potentially.

unique_experiences.activity: Take a Fähri Across the Rhine
unique_experiences.where: Four crossing points: St. Alban, Münster, Klingental, St. Johann
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a charming, short ride on a traditional current-powered ferry, offering unique perspectives of the city skyline from the water.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Small cash fee required. A relaxing way to cross between Grossbasel and Kleinbasel.

weather.precipitation: Often features more stable, warm, and sunny weather, feeling like early summer. However, afternoon showers or thunderstorms remain possible.
weather.general_tips: Likely need lighter clothing (t-shirts, light trousers/shorts), but keep a sweater/light jacket for evenings/cooler days. Sun protection essential.

tourism_level.crowds: High season feeling develops. Busy, especially on sunny weekends and around any late public holidays.
tourism_level.pricing: High season prices generally apply. Advance booking for accommodation strongly recommended.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful late spring/early summer. Ideal conditions for enjoying the Rhine banks, parks, and outdoor dining. Vibrant city life.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Auffahrt / Jeudi de l'Ascension)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often late May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday creating a long weekend for many. Shops closed.
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Attractions usually open. Can be a busy travel weekend.

events_holidays.name: Whit Monday (Pfingstmontag) (Potential Timing)
events_holidays.date: Varies (50 days after Easter - often late May/early June)
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Attractions typically open.

events_holidays.name: Merian Gärten in Full Bloom
events_holidays.description: Visit the expansive Merian Gärten in Brüglingen to see impressive collections of irises, peonies, roses, and more reaching their peak.
events_holidays.notes: Accessible by tram. A beautiful large park south of the city.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the world-class modern and contemporary art collection in Renzo Piano's stunning building, set within a beautiful park.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 2-3 hours plus travel. Check opening hours. Combine with a walk in the park.

unique_experiences.where: Various locations along the Kleinbasel Rhine promenade
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy drinks and snacks at one of the seasonal riverside kiosks ('Buvetten'), soaking up the sun and atmosphere as locals do.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Casual atmosphere. Opening times weather-dependent. Great people-watching spots.

unique_experiences.description: Discover the playful and fascinating kinetic sculptures of Swiss artist Jean Tinguely in a dedicated museum by the Rhine.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Interactive exhibits. Allow 1-2 hours. Combine with a walk in Solitude Park.

unique_experiences.activity: Day Trip to Alsace or Black Forest
unique_experiences.description: Take advantage of Basel's location for a day trip. Explore charming French villages like Colmar or Eguisheim, or hike/visit towns in Germany's Black Forest.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Easily accessible by train or car. Plan your route and check transport schedules.
